n50.name: N50 Value
n50.description: The length of the shortest read that together with other reads, represents at least 50% of the nucleotides in a set of

%_gc.name: GC Content
%_gc.description: The percent of a nucleotide sequence comprised of guanine and cytosine

serotype.name: Serotype
serotype.x-hint: Select a value from the template list.
serotype.description: The antigenic classification of a bacterial or viral isolate based on its surface antigens. Serotyping identifies subtypes within a species that may differ in pathogenicity, epidemiology, or vaccine coverage.

study_id.name: Study ID
study_id.description: A unique identifier assigned to a research study, project, or surveillance activity under which the sample or sequence was collected. It links multiple samples and datasets to a common research context or investigation, allowing traceability and aggregation of related data

serogroup.name: Serogroup
serogroup.x-hint: Select a value from the template list.
serogroup.description: A higher-level antigenic grouping of isolates based on shared surface antigens, often encompassing multiple serotypes.

isolate_id.name: Isolate ID
isolate_id.x-hint: Required field: needs to be unique value.
isolate_id.description: describes the identifier of the specific isolate

biospecimen.name: Biospecimen
biospecimen.x-hint: Required field: select a value from the template list.
biospecimen.description: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes

subject_sex.name: Sex
subject_sex.x-hint: Select a value from the template list.
subject_sex.description: A subject sex is the phenotypic sex of given subject (human or animal) related to a given investigation, study, and/or specimen

lineage_name.name: Lineage Name
lineage_name.description: name of the lineage or clade

sra_accession.name: SRA Accession
sra_accession.description: describes the Sequence Read Archive (SRA), European Nucleotide Archive (ENA) or DDBJ Sequence Read Archive (DRA) identifier linking raw read data, methodological metadata and quality control metrics submitted to the International Nucleotide Sequence Database Collaboration (INSDC)

case_identifier.name: Case ID
case_identifier.description: A case ID is a unique identifier associated with a particular episode of care for an individual or animal.

fasta_file_name.name: FASTA File
fasta_file_name.x-hint: Filename needs to match FASTA filename exactly.
fasta_file_name.description: The name of the file containing nucleotide or protein sequence(s) formatted in the FASTA standard. The filename serves as a reference to the physical data file associated with the sample or sequencing submission.

resistant_genes.name: Resistant Genes
resistant_genes.x-hint: Select one or more value from the template list.
resistant_genes.description: Genes detected in an organism that confer resistance to one or more antimicrobial agents. These genes may be located on the chromosome or mobile genetic elements such as plasmids or transposons. This field records the specific resistance genes identified in the sample.

sequencing_date.name: Sequencing Date
sequencing_date.description: describes the date the sample was sequenced

sequencing_type.name: Sequencing Type
sequencing_type.description: The sequence type assigned to an isolate according to a specific typing method. For example, in MLST, the sequence type is a numerical designation (ST) representing the allelic profile of multiple loci.

sequencing_depth.name: Read Depth
sequencing_depth.description: The number of times a particular locus (site, nucleotide, amplicon, region) was sequenced

subject_age_unit.name: Age Unit
subject_age_unit.x-hint: Select a value from the template list.
subject_age_unit.description: Age unit of the age measurement of a subject

collection_device.name: Collection Device
collection_device.x-hint: Select a value from the template list.
collection_device.description: describes the instrument or container used to collect the sample

fasta_header_name.name: FASTA Header
fasta_header_name.x-hint: FASTA header name needs to match the record in the attached FASTA file.
fasta_header_name.description: A unique sequence identifier found in the header line of a FASTA-formatted sequence file. It typically begins with the “>” character and may include accession numbers, sample IDs, or organism identifiers that link the sequence record to its corresponding metadata

geo_loc_name_city.name: City
geo_loc_name_city.description: the name of the organization with which the sample collector is affiliated

median_read_depth.name: Median Depth
median_read_depth.description: The median number of reads covering each position in the assembled genome or sequencing target. It provides a measure of sequencing coverage uniformity, reducing the influence of extreme high or low coverage regions.

vaccination_status.name: Vaccination Status
vaccination_status.x-hint: Select a value from the template list.
vaccination_status.description: describes the vaccination status of the patient

biosample_accession.name: BioSample Accession
biosample_accession.description: describes the identifier assigned to a BioSample in International Nucleotide Sequence Database Collaboration (INSDC) archives

plasmids_identified.name: Plasmids Identified
plasmids_identified.x-hint: Select one or more value from the template list.
plasmids_identified.description: A plasmid is an extrachromosomal, usually circular DNA molecule found in bacteria that can carry genes conferring traits such as antimicrobial resistance or virulence. This field records the presence and, if known, the specific identity or type of plasmid detected in a sample. Multiple plasmids may be present in a single isolate.

purpose_of_sampling.name: Sampling Purpose
purpose_of_sampling.x-hint: Select a value from the template list.
purpose_of_sampling.description: describes the reason that the sample was collected

sample_collected_by.name: Sample ID
sample_collected_by.description: the name of the organization with which the sample collector is affiliated

sample_receive_date.name: Collection Date
sample_receive_date.x-hint: Date needs to be after the Sample Collection date. Only use YYYY-MM-DD format (e.g. 2025-10-29).
sample_receive_date.description: A data field which describes the date on which the sample was received at the laboratory

assembly_genome_size.name: Genome Size
assembly_genome_size.description: The assembly genome size is the sum of all lengths of a sequence assembly's contigs

geo_loc_name_country.name: Country
geo_loc_name_country.x-hint: Required field: select a country from the template Country list.
geo_loc_name_country.description: country of origin of the sample

purpose_of_sequencing.name: Sequencing Purpose
purpose_of_sequencing.x-hint: Select a value from the template list.
purpose_of_sequencing.description: describes the reason that the sample was sequenced

sequencing_instrument.name: Sequencing Instrument
sequencing_instrument.x-hint: Select a value from the template list.
sequencing_instrument.description: describes the model of the sequencing instrument used

other_resistance_genes.name: Other Resistance Genes
other_resistance_genes.description: Genes detected in an organism that confer resistance to one or more antimicrobial agents. These genes may be located on the chromosome or mobile genetic elements such as plasmids or transposons. This field records the specific resistance genes identified in the sample.

sample_collection_date.name: Collection Date
sample_collection_date.x-hint: Required field: Date needs to be before the Sample Receive date. Only use YYYY-MM-DD format (e.g. 2025-10-29).
sample_collection_date.description: the date on which the sample was collected.

virulence_factor_genes.name: Virulence Gene
virulence_factor_genes.x-hint: Select one or more value from the template list.
virulence_factor_genes.description: The name of the virulence factor molecule produced by a pathogen that specifically causes disease, or that influences the host's function to allow the pathogen to thrive

consensus_genome_length.name: Genome Length
consensus_genome_length.description: describes the file size of the assembled genome described as the number of base pairs

subject_disease_outcome.name: Disease Outcome
subject_disease_outcome.x-hint: Select a value from the template list.
subject_disease_outcome.description: describes the disease outcome in the patient

sequencing_typing_method.name: Typing Method
sequencing_typing_method.description: The method or scheme used to determine the genetic type of an organism based on sequence data. This can include approaches like multilocus sequence typing (MLST), core genome MLST (cgMLST), single nucleotide polymorphism (SNP) typing, or other genome-based typing schemes.

date_of_last_vaccine_dose.name: Last Vaccine
date_of_last_vaccine_dose.description: provides the date on which the last vaccine was received

other_plasmids_identified.name: Other Plasmids Identified
other_plasmids_identified.description: A plasmid is an extrachromosomal, usually circular DNA molecule found in bacteria that can carry genes conferring traits such as antimicrobial resistance or virulence. This field records the presence and, if known, the specific identity or type of plasmid detected in a sample. Multiple plasmids may be present in a single isolate.

most_recent_departure_date.name: Departure Date
most_recent_departure_date.description: date of an individual's most recent departure from their primary residence (at time of data collection) on a journey to one or more other locations.

reference_genome_accession.name: Reference Accession
reference_genome_accession.description: the accession number of the reference genome

other_virulence_factor_genes.name: Other Virulence Gene
other_virulence_factor_genes.description: The name of the virulence factor molecule produced by a pathogen that specifically causes disease, or that influences the host's function to allow the pathogen to thrive

specimen_collector_sample_id.name: Sample ID
specimen_collector_sample_id.description: The user-defined name for the sample

nucleic_acid_extraction_method.name: Extraction Method
nucleic_acid_extraction_method.description: Any procedure used to purify nucleic acids (DNA or RNA) from a biological sample

ampicillin_resistance_phenotype.name: Ampicillin Result
ampicillin_resistance_phenotype.x-hint: Select a value from the template list.
ampicillin_resistance_phenotype.description: Phenotypic outcome of antimicrobial susceptibility testing for ampicillin.

sequence_assembly_software_name.name: Assembly Software
sequence_assembly_software_name.description: The software tool used to assemble raw sequencing reads into a contiguous genome or sequence. Examples include SPAdes, Velvet, or Canu.

number_of_vaccine_doses_received.name: Vaccine Doses
number_of_vaccine_doses_received.description: describes the number of doses of vaccine received by the patient

azithromycin_resistance_phenotype.name: Azithromycin Result
azithromycin_resistance_phenotype.x-hint: Select a value from the template list.
azithromycin_resistance_phenotype.description: Phenotypic outcome of antimicrobial susceptibility testing for azithromycin, indicating whether the organism is resistant, intermediate, or susceptible.

specimen_source_material_category.name: Source Material
specimen_source_material_category.x-hint: Required field: select a value from the template list.
specimen_source_material_category.description: The type of material from which the specimen was obtained

sulfinamides_resistance_phenotype.name: Sulfinamides Result
sulfinamides_resistance_phenotype.x-hint: Select a value from the template list.
sulfinamides_resistance_phenotype.description: Phenotypic outcome of antimicrobial susceptibility testing for sulfinamides.

ciprofloxacin_resistance_phenotype.name: Ciprofloxacin Result
ciprofloxacin_resistance_phenotype.x-hint: Select a value from the template list.
ciprofloxacin_resistance_phenotype.description: Phenotypic outcome of antimicrobial susceptibility testing for ciprofloxacin.

sequence_assembly_software_version.name: Software Version
sequence_assembly_software_version.description: The version number of the genome assembly software used. Versioning ensures reproducibility and helps track differences in results due to software updates.

chloramphenicol_resistance_phenotype.name: Chloramphenicol Result
chloramphenicol_resistance_phenotype.x-hint: Select a value from the template list.
chloramphenicol_resistance_phenotype.description: Phenotypic outcome of antimicrobial susceptibility testing for chloramphenicol.

geo_loc_name_state_province_territory.name: Province
geo_loc_name_state_province_territory.x-hint: Required field: select a state from the template State list.
geo_loc_name_state_province_territory.description: describes the state, province, or territory of origin of the sample

enum: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands
destination_of_most_recent_travel_countr.name: Recent Destination
destination_of_most_recent_travel_countr.x-hint: Select a country from the template Country list.
destination_of_most_recent_travel_countr.description: describes the name of the country that was the destination of most recent travel

subject_age_at_the_time_of_specimen_coll.name: Age
subject_age_at_the_time_of_specimen_coll.description: A subject age at time of specimen extraction is the age (since birth) of the organism at the time a given specimen was extracted

tretracycline_or_doxycycline_resistance_.name: Tetracycline/Doxycycline Result
tretracycline_or_doxycycline_resistance_.x-hint: Select a value from the template list.
tretracycline_or_doxycycline_resistance_.description: Phenotypic outcome of antimicrobial susceptibility testing for tetracycline or doxycycline.

trimethroprim_sulfamethoxazole_resistanc.name: Trimethroprim Result
trimethroprim_sulfamethoxazole_resistanc.x-hint: Select a value from the template list.
trimethroprim_sulfamethoxazole_resistanc.description: Phenotypic outcome of antimicrobial susceptibility testing for trimethroprim-sulfamethoxazole.
